channel.title: Projects on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Home

item.title: Project 1: Employee Retention Issue
item.description: Employee attrition or turnover occurs when an employee leaves the organization. It is different from employee discharge, termination, resignation, and abandonment. In the case of employee attrition, when an employee leaves the company, the employee position remains unfilled. But in the case of turnover, the position is filled by a replacement employee. It is a critical problem for employers as it impacts their growth and ability to complete. Here, I will discuss how we can build a model that can help the HR team in identifying employees that can leave the organization so that they can work with employees and take corrective measures to reduce the attrition rate problem by working with employees at risk of leaving the organization.

item.title: Project 2: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: In this project I did some exploratory analysis to answer certain questions like: After certain age as the athletes get older their chances of winning medals in Olympic decreases. Young athlete wins more modals as compared to older athlete. I will be doing EDA on this dataset using Python to answer this question. Link to GitHub Table of Contents Introduction Data Background Prerequisite Project Status Versioning Authors Acknowledgement Reference Introduction EDA is one of the critical process that we need to perform in our initial investigation to get good understanding about the dataset.

item.title: Project 4: Credit Card Fraud Detection
item.description: We have witnessed an enormous evolution in credit card processing over last few years, issuing chip-based credit cards, starting mobile device-based wallets like Apple Pay are some significant changes done to secure credit card transactions. The scope of this project is to research and identify different types of predictive analysis algorithms available that can be applied to determine and stop fraudulent transactions. Using this project I will get to learn more on anomaly detection and analysis.

item.title: Project 5: Twitter Sentimental Analysis
item.description: Sentiment analysis is widely applied to voice of the customer materials such as reviews and survey responses, online and social media, and healthcare materials for applications that range from marketing to customer service to clinical medicine. Using this project I will perform sentimental analysis using Twitter data. This will help me learn more about NLP. Link to GitHub Table of Contents Introduction Data Background Prerequisite Project Status Versioning Authors Acknowledgement Reference Introduction back to top

item.title: Project 6: Image Classification
item.description: Image classification is a technique which we use to identify object with-in the image. Using this project I will learn how can we perform Image classification using Keras & TensorFlow. item.title: Project 7: Web-Scraping through Python
item.description: Web scraping is the process of collecting and parsing raw data from the Web. It is one of the important way of getting data when there is no way to get data through API or any other means. Using this project I will learn more about Web-Scraping techniques we can use to get data. item.title: Project 9: Poster on Stock Price Prediction
item.description: The Stock Market is a complex world in itself, and the stock price movement is hard to predict. Accurate predictions on how stocks are going to perform remain a crucial issue in finance. Participants in trading are constantly looking for techniques that can better predict stock price movements. Technical and Fundamental indicators based on the past performance of stocks can help us understand how the stocks are going to perform. However, many factors can impact market sentiments like political news, social media buzz, and the latest developments in the company are a few of the examples which can change the stock trends.

item.title: Project 10: Time Series Modelling
item.description: Time series analysis uses methods to analyze time series data using statistics and other analytics methods. Time series forecasting is used to predict future values based on historical data.
